value.value: Parse xml_string and return the root element of the XML document

generated_code:
import xml.etree.ElementTree as ET

def parse_xml(xml_string):
    """
    Parse xml_string and return the root element of the XML document
    
    Args:
        xml_string: A string containing XML data
        
    Returns:
        The root element of the parsed XML document
    """
    # Parse the XML string into an ElementTree object
    tree = ET.ElementTree(ET.fromstring(xml_string))
    
    # Get and return the root element
    root = tree.getroot()
    
    return root

findings.message: Using xml.etree.ElementTree.fromstring to parse untrusted XML data is known to be vulnerable to XML attacks. Replace xml.etree.ElementTree.fromstring with its defusedxml equivalent function or make sure defusedxml.defuse_stdlib() is called
